Class CaveNode

java.lang.Object
CaveNode
public class CaveNode
extends java.lang.Object
CaveNode class is the building block of the cave adventure. Each room will consist of a CaveNode that contains the pertinent information about the room's contents and description.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    boolean exitedFirst
    Flag used only for the first cave to hold off on displaying flavor text that prevents escape through the entrance.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CaveNode​(int level, java.lang.String adj1, java.lang.String adj2, CaveNode previous)
    Builds a CaveNode and populates it with the appropriate monsters and items, at the appropriate level.

  • Field Details

    • exitedFirst

      public boolean exitedFirst
      Flag used only for the first cave to hold off on displaying flavor text that prevents escape through the entrance.
      Since:
      1.6

  • Constructor Details

    • CaveNode

      public CaveNode​(int level, java.lang.String adj1, java.lang.String adj2, CaveNode previous)
      Builds a CaveNode and populates it with the appropriate monsters and items, at the appropriate level. Determines which paths forward exist.
      Parameters:
      level - The player's level at the time of entering the cavern.
      adj1 - The first word describing this particular cavern.
      adj2 - The second word describing this particular cavern.
      previous - The previous cave in the tree.
      Since:
      1.5

  • Method Details

    • hasLeft

      public boolean hasLeft()
      Getter for examining paths forward.
      Returns:
      true if there is a left-hand path
      Since:
      1.6

    • hasRight

      public boolean hasRight()
      Getter for examining paths forward.
      Returns:
      true if there is a right-hand path
      Since:
      1.6

    • hasCenter

      public boolean hasCenter()
      Getter for examining paths forward.
      Returns:
      true if there is a path directly ahead
      Since:
      1.6

    • getPrev

      public CaveNode getPrev()
      Retrieves reference the the 'parent' cavern.
      Returns:
      The parent CaveNode
      Since:
      1.6

    • getRight

      public CaveNode getRight()
      Returns the right cave object, if there is one.
      Returns:
      The cave to the right.
      Since:
      1.6

    • getLeft

      public CaveNode getLeft()
      Returns the left cave object, if there is one.
      Returns:
      The cave to the left.
      Since:
      1.6

    • getCenter

      public CaveNode getCenter()
      Returns the center cave object, if there is one.
      Returns:
      The cave directly ahead.
      Since:
      1.6

    • setPrev

      public void setPrev​(CaveNode parent)
      Sets the parent reference to the provided node.
      Parameters:
      parent - The parent of this node.
      Since:
      1.6

    • setPath

      public void setPath​(java.lang.String which, CaveNode neighbor)
      Setter to link a new cave at the appropriate position.
      Parameters:
      which - Which path forward. Only acceptable entries are right/left/center.
      neighbor - The new node to be linked in.
      Since:
      1.6

    • hasLoot

      public boolean hasLoot()
      Accessor to check if this cavern has loots.
      Returns:
      If the cavern has loot or not.
      Since:
      1.1

    • beenSearched

      public boolean beenSearched()
      Accessor to check if this cavern has been searched.
      Returns:
      If this cavern has been searched yet.
      Since:
      1.1

    • beenSearched

      public boolean beenSearched​(boolean wasSearched)
      Override method to set the searched status of the node.
      Parameters:
      wasSearched - What to set the search status to.
      Returns:
      If this cavern has been searched yet.
      Since:
      1.7

    • hasMonster

      public boolean hasMonster()
      Accessor to check if this cavern has a monster.
      Returns:
      If there is a monster here.
      Since:
      1.1

    • getMonster

      public Monster getMonster() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Gives the caller a pointer to the Monster object in this cave.
      Returns:
      The monster in this cave.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no monster in this cave.
      Since:
      1.1

    • killMonster

      public int killMonster() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Eliminates the monster from this cavern when the monster is killed.
      Returns:
      The XP value of the eliminated monster.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no monster in here.
      Since:
      1.7

    • monsterMaker

      public void monsterMaker​(int level)
      Function that is guaranteed to generate a monster. Used for naps and as a helper with normal cave generation.
      Parameters:
      level - The current level of the player at the time of generation.
      Since:
      1.7

    • lootGen

      public void lootGen​(int level, java.lang.String qualifier)
      Decides is there is loot upon intial generation, and generates that loot if necessary.
      Parameters:
      qualifier - A string that differentiates normal generation and search generation.
      level - The level of the player at the time of calling
      Since:
      1.7

    • getLoot

      public Item getLoot() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Returns the current loot type, if there is loot.
      Returns:
      The loot item in this cavern.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no loot in this cavern.
      Since:
      1.3

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      General toString method. Gives string in the form "a adj, adj cavern"
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A string describing the cavern.
      Since:
      1.4

    • printPaths

      public void printPaths()
      Prints the configuration of the path forward from this cave to the console.
      Since:
      1.4

    • clearLoot

      public void clearLoot()
      Clears the chamber's loot reference.
      Since:
      1.7
